content.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for SC students
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: The objective of the scheme is to appreciably increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio of SC students in higher education with a focus on those from the poorest households, by providing financial assistance at post-matriculation or post-secondary stage to enable them to complete their education. These scholarships are available for studies in India only and the awardees are selected by the State Government/Union Territory to which the applicant actually belongs.
benefits: Financial assistance for various groups of courses
₹ 13,000/- for Group-1 hostellers, ₹ 7,000/- for day scholars
₹ 9,500/- for Group-2 hostellers, ₹ 6,500/- for day scholars
₹ 6,000/- for Group-3 hostellers, ₹ 3,000/- for day scholars
₹ 4,000/- for Group-4 hostellers, ₹ 2,500/- for day scholars
eligibility: Candidates must belong to Scheduled Castes
Must have passed Matriculation, Higher Secondary, or a higher examination
Parents' or guardians' income must not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/- per annum
Candidates studying in the same stage of education in a different subject are not eligible
Students pursuing studies through correspondence or online courses are eligible
All children of any parent or guardian are entitled to receive benefits
A scholarship holder will not hold any other scholarship or stipend
content.application_process: Online registration through the official NSP website.

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste (SC) Students is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme implemented by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India.

faqs.question: What are the main objectives of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to appreciably increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio of SC students in higher education with a focus on those from the poorest households.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided under the scheme?
What benefits are provided to the Disabled students?
faqs.answer: A 10% extra allowance shall be given to Divyang (Disabled) students.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits?
faqs.answer: The scholarships are open to Indian nationals only.

faqs.question: What is the eligible income criteria?
faqs.answer: Scholarships will be paid to students whose parents' or guardians' income from all sources does not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/- per annum.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to apply?
faqs.answer: Applicant must register themselves on the NSP portal and login with their credentials to apply.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: Photograph, Academic Certificate, Caste Certificate, Income proof, Domicile Certificate, Bank Account Details, Aadhaar Card.
